force:package:beta:convert.description:
creates a second-generation package version from a first-generation package

The package convert creates a new package in the Dev Hub if one does not already exist for the specified first-generation package.

It then creates a new package version in the Dev Hub with contents based on the specified first-generation package.

The latest released non-patch package version from the specified first-generation package will be converted.

To retrieve details about a package version create request, including status and package version ID (04t), run "sfdx force:package:version:create:report -i 08c...".

We recommend specifying the --installationkey to protect the contents of your package and to prevent unauthorized installation of your package.

To list package version creation requests in the org, run "sfdx force:package:version:create:list".

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

package.name: package
package.description: ID (starts with 033) of the first-generation package to convert

installationkey.name: installationkey
installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)

definitionfile.name: definitionfile
definitionfile.description: path to a definition file that contains features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on.

installationkeybypass.name: installationkeybypass
installationkeybypass.description: bypass the installation key requirement (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)

wait.name: wait
wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created

buildinstance.name: buildinstance
buildinstance.description: the instance where the conversion package version will be created——for example, NA50

package.description: ID (starts with 033) of the first-generation package to convert
package.longDescription: The ID (starts with 033) or alias of the package to convert.

installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)
installationkey.longDescription: Installation key for creating the key-protected package. Either an --installationkey value or the --installationkeybypass flag is required.

definitionfile.description: path to a definition file that contains features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on.
definitionfile.longDescription: The path to a definition file, similar to the scratch org definition file, that contains the list of features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on.

installationkeybypass.description: bypass the installation key requirement (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)
installationkeybypass.longDescription: Bypasses the installation key requirement. If you bypass this requirement, anyone can install your package. Either an --installationkey value or the --installationkeybypass flag is required.

wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created
wait.longDescription: The number of minutes to wait for the package version to be created.

buildinstance.description: the instance where the conversion package version will be created——for example, NA50
buildinstance.longDescription: The instance where the conversion package version will be created——for example, NA50.

force:package:beta:create.description:
create a package

First, use this command to create a package. Then create a package version.

If you don’t have a namespace defined in your sfdx-project.json file, use --nonamespace.

Your --name value must be unique within your namespace.

Run 'sfdx force:package:list' to list all packages in the Dev Hub org.
examples: $ sfdx force:package:create -n YourPackageName -d "Your Package Descripton" -t Unlocked -r force-app

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

nonamespace.name: nonamespace
nonamespace.description: creates the package with no namespace; available only for unlocked packages.

path.name: path
path.description: path to directory that contains the contents of the package

orgdependent.name: orgdependent
orgdependent.description: depends on unpackaged metadata in the installation org. Applies to unlocked packages only.

errornotificationusername.name: errornotificationusername
errornotificationusername.description: active Dev Hub user designated to receive email notifications for package errors

name.longDescription: Name of the package to create.

packagetype.longDescription:
Package type for the package.
The options for package type are Managed and Unlocked (Managed=DeveloperManagedSubscriberManaged, Unlocked=DeveloperControlledSubscriberEditable).
These options determine upgrade and editability rules.

nonamespace.description: creates the package with no namespace; available only for unlocked packages.
nonamespace.longDescription: Creates the package with no namespace. Available only for unlocked packages. Useful when you’re migrating an existing org to packages. But, use a namespaced package for new metadata.

path.description: path to directory that contains the contents of the package
path.longDescription: The path to the directory that contains the contents of the package.

orgdependent.description: depends on unpackaged metadata in the installation org. Applies to unlocked packages only.
orgdependent.longDescription:
Package depends on unpackaged metadata in the installation org. Applies to unlocked packages only.
Use Source Tracking in Sandboxes to develop your org-dependent unlocked package.
For more information, see "Create Org-Dependent Unlocked Packages" in the Salesforce DX Developer Guide.

errornotificationusername.description: active Dev Hub user designated to receive email notifications for package errors
errornotificationusername.longDescription: An active Dev Hub org user designated to receive email notifications for unhandled Apex exceptions, and install, upgrade, or uninstall failures associated with your package.

force:package:beta:delete.description:
delete a package

Specify the ID or alias of the package you want to delete.

Delete unlocked and second-generation managed packages. Before you delete a package, first delete all associated package versions.

noprompt.longDescription: Don’t prompt before deleting the package.

package.description: ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to delete
package.longDescription: The ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to delete.

force:package:beta:install.description:
install a package in the target org

Supply the ID of the package version to install. The package installs in your default target org unless you supply the username for a different target org.

For package upgrades, to specify options for component deprecation or deletion of removed components, include an --upgradetype value. To delete components that can be safely deleted and deprecate the others, specify --upgradetype Mixed (the default). To deprecate all removed components, specify --upgradetype DeprecateOnly. To delete all removed components, except for custom objects and custom fields, that don't have dependencies, specify --upgradetype Delete. (Note: This option can result in the loss of data that is associated with the deleted components.) The default is Mixed.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

wait.name: wait
wait.description: number of minutes to wait for installation status

installationkey.name: installationkey
installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (default: null)

publishwait.name: publishwait
publishwait.description: number of minutes to wait for subscriber package version ID to become available in the target org

package.name: package
package.description: ID (starts with 04t) or alias of the package version to install

apexcompile.name: apexcompile
apexcompile.description: compile all Apex in the org and package, or only Apex in the package; unlocked packages only

securitytype.name: securitytype
securitytype.description: security access type for the installed package (deprecation notice: The default --securitytype value will change from AllUsers to AdminsOnly in v47.0 or later.)

upgradetype.name: upgradetype
upgradetype.description: the upgrade type for the package installation; available only for unlocked packages

wait.description: number of minutes to wait for installation status
wait.longDescription: Maximum number of minutes to wait for installation status. The default is 0.

installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (default: null)
installationkey.longDescription: Installation key for installing a key-protected package. The default is null.

publishwait.description: number of minutes to wait for subscriber package version ID to become available in the target org
publishwait.longDescription: Maximum number of minutes to wait for the Subscriber Package Version ID to become available in the target org before canceling the install request. The default is 0.

noprompt.longDescription: Allows the following without an explicit confirmation response: 1) Remote Site Settings and Content Security Policy websites to send or receive data, and 2) --upgradetype Delete to proceed.

package.description: ID (starts with 04t) or alias of the package version to install
package.longDescription: The ID (starts with 04t) or alias of the package version to install.

apexcompile.description: compile all Apex in the org and package, or only Apex in the package; unlocked packages only
apexcompile.longDescription:
Applies to unlocked packages only. Specifies whether to compile all Apex in the org and package, or only the Apex in the package.
For package installs into production orgs, or any org that has Apex Compile on Deploy enabled, the platform compiles all Apex in the org after the package install or upgrade operation completes.
This approach assures that package installs and upgrades don’t impact the performance of an org, and is done even if --apexcompile package is specified.

securitytype.description: security access type for the installed package (deprecation notice: The default --securitytype value will change from AllUsers to AdminsOnly in v47.0 or later.)
securitytype.longDescription: Security access type for the installed package.

upgradetype.description: the upgrade type for the package installation; available only for unlocked packages
upgradetype.longDescription: For package upgrades, specifies whether to mark all removed components as deprecated (DeprecateOnly), to delete removed components that can be safely deleted and deprecate the others (Mixed), or to delete all removed components, except for custom objects and custom fields, that don't have dependencies (Delete). The default is Mixed. Can specify DeprecateOnly or Delete only for unlocked package upgrades.

force:package:beta:uninstall.description:
uninstall a second-generation package from the target org

Specify the package ID for a second-generation package.

To list the org’s installed packages, run "sfdx force:package:beta:installed:list".

To uninstall a first-generation package, from Setup, enter Installed Packages in the Quick Find box, then select Installed Packages.

force:package:beta:version:create.description:
Creates a package version in the Dev Hub org.

The package version is based on the package contents in the specified directory.

To retrieve details about a package version create request, including status and package version ID (04t), run "sfdx force:package:version:create:report -i 08c...".

We recommend that you specify the --installationkey parameter to protect the contents of your package and to prevent unauthorized installation of your package.

To list package version creation requests in the org, run "sfdx force:package:version:create:list".

To promote a package version to released, you must use the --codecoverage parameter. The package must also meet the code coverage requirements. This requirement applies to both managed and unlocked packages.

We don’t calculate code coverage for org-dependent unlocked packages, or for package versions that specify --skipvalidation.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

buildinstance.name: buildinstance
buildinstance.description: the instance where the package version will be created——for example, NA50

codecoverage.name: codecoverage
codecoverage.description: calculate the code coverage by running the packaged Apex tests

definitionfile.name: definitionfile
definitionfile.description: path to a definition file similar to scratch org definition file that contains the list of features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on

installationkey.name: installationkey
installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)

installationkeybypass.name: installationkeybypass
installationkeybypass.description: bypass the installation key requirement (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)

package.name: package
package.description: ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to create a version of

path.name: path
path.description: path to directory that contains the contents of the package

postinstallscript.name: postinstallscript
postinstallscript.description: post-install script name; managed packages only

preserve.name: preserve
preserve.description: temp files are preserved that would otherwise be deleted

skipvalidation.name: skipvalidation
skipvalidation.description: skip validation during package version creation; you can’t promote unvalidated package versions

uninstallscript.name: uninstallscript
uninstallscript.description: uninstall script name; managed packages only

validateschema.name: validateschema
validateschema.description: sfdx-project.json is validated against JSON schema

versiondescription.name: versiondescription
versiondescription.description: the description of the package version to be created

versionname.name: versionname
versionname.description: the name of the package version to be created

versionnumber.name: versionnumber
versionnumber.description: the version number of the package version to be created

wait.name: wait
wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created

branch.longDescription: Name of the branch in your source control system that the package version is based on.

buildinstance.description: the instance where the package version will be created——for example, NA50
buildinstance.longDescription: The instance where the package version will be created——for example, NA50.

codecoverage.description: calculate the code coverage by running the packaged Apex tests
codecoverage.longDescription: Calculate and store the code coverage percentage by running the Apex tests included in this package version. Before you can promote and release a managed or unlocked package version, the Apex code must meet a minimum 75% code coverage requirement. We don’t calculate code coverage for org-dependent unlocked packages or for package versions that specify --skipvalidation.

definitionfile.description: path to a definition file similar to scratch org definition file that contains the list of features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on
definitionfile.longDescription: The path to a definition file similar to scratch org definition file that contains the list of features and org preferences that the metadata of the package version depends on.

installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)
installationkey.longDescription: Installation key for creating the key-protected package. Either an --installationkey value or the --installationkeybypass flag is required.

installationkeybypass.description: bypass the installation key requirement (either --installationkey or --installationkeybypass is required)
installationkeybypass.longDescription: Bypasses the installation key requirement. If you bypass this requirement, anyone can install your package. Either an --installationkey value or the --installationkeybypass flag is required.

package.description: ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to create a version of
package.longDescription: The ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias of the package to create a version of.

path.description: path to directory that contains the contents of the package
path.longDescription: The path to the directory that contains the contents of the package.

postinstallscript.description: post-install script name; managed packages only
postinstallscript.longDescription: Applies to managed packages only. The post-install script name. The post-install script is an Apex class within this package that is run in the installing org after installations or upgrades of this package version.

postinstallurl.longDescription: The post-install instructions URL. The contents of the post-installation instructions URL are displayed in the UI after installation of the package version.

preserve.description: temp files are preserved that would otherwise be deleted
preserve.longDescription: Specifies that the temp files are preserved that would otherwise be deleted

releasenotesurl.longDescription: The release notes URL. This link is displayed in the package installation UI to provide release notes for this package version to subscribers.

skipancestorcheck.longDescription: Override ancestry requirements, which allows you to specify a package ancestor that isn’t the highest released package version.

skipvalidation.description: skip validation during package version creation; you can’t promote unvalidated package versions
skipvalidation.longDescription: Skips validation of dependencies, package ancestors, and metadata during package version creation. Skipping validation reduces the time it takes to create a new package version, but you can promote only validated package versions. Skipping validation can suppress important errors that can surface at a later stage. You can specify skip validation or code coverage, but not both. Code coverage is calculated during validation.

uninstallscript.description: uninstall script name; managed packages only
uninstallscript.longDescription: Applies to managed packages only. The uninstall script name. The uninstall script is an Apex class within this package that is run in the installing org after uninstallations of this package.

validateschema.description: sfdx-project.json is validated against JSON schema
validateschema.longDescription: Specifies that the sfdx-project.json file should be validated against JSON schema.

versiondescription.description: the description of the package version to be created
versiondescription.longDescription: The description of the package version to be created. Overrides the sfdx-project.json value.

versionname.description: the name of the package version to be created
versionname.longDescription: The name of the package version to be created. Overrides the sfdx-project.json value.

versionnumber.description: the version number of the package version to be created
versionnumber.longDescription: The version number of the package version to be created. Overrides the sfdx-project.json value.

wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created
wait.longDescription: The number of minutes to wait for the package version to be created.

force:package:beta:version:displayancest.description: display the ancestry tree for a 2GP managed package version

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

package.name: package
package.description: ID or alias of the package (starts with 0Ho) or package version (starts with 04t) to display ancestry for

dotcode.name: dotcode
dotcode.description: display the ancestry tree in DOT code

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: display both the package version ID (starts with 04t) and the version number (major.minor.patch.build) in the ancestry tree

package.description: ID or alias of the package (starts with 0Ho) or package version (starts with 04t) to display ancestry for
package.longDescription:
The ID or alias of the package or package version to display ancestry for. If you specify a package ID (starts with 0Ho) or alias, the ancestor tree for every package version associated with the package ID is displayed.
If you specify a package version (starts with 04t) or alias, the ancestry tree of the specified package version is displayed.

dotcode.description: display the ancestry tree in DOT code
dotcode.longDescription: Displays the ancestry tree in DOT code. You can use the DOT code output in graph visualization software to create tree visualizations.

verbose.description: display both the package version ID (starts with 04t) and the version number (major.minor.patch.build) in the ancestry tree
verbose.longDescription: Displays both the package version ID (starts with 04t) and the version number (major.minor.patch.build) in the ancestry tree.

force:package:beta:version:list.description:
list all package versions in the Dev Hub org.

Displays details of each package version in the org.

Use --concise or --verbose to display limited or additional details, respectively.

All filter parameters are applied using the AND logical operator (not OR).

modifiedlastdays.name: modifiedlastdays
modifiedlastdays.description: list items modified in the specified last number of days (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today)

packages.name: packages
packages.description: filter results on specified comma-delimited packages (aliases or 0Ho IDs)

orderby.name: orderby
orderby.description: order by the specified package version fields

createdlastdays.description: created in the last specified number of days (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today)
createdlastdays.longDescription: Filters the list based on the specified maximum number of days since the request was created (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today).

modifiedlastdays.description: list items modified in the specified last number of days (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today)
modifiedlastdays.longDescription: Lists the items modified in the specified last number of days, starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now. Use 0 for today.

packages.description: filter results on specified comma-delimited packages (aliases or 0Ho IDs)
packages.longDescription: Filters results on the specified comma-delimited packages (aliases or 0Ho IDs).

orderby.description: order by the specified package version fields
orderby.longDescription: Orders the list by the specified package version fields.

packageid.description: ID of the metadata package (starts with 033) of which you’re creating a new version

version.name: version
version.description: package version in major.minor format, for example, 3.2

installationkey.name: installationkey
installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (default: null)

wait.name: wait
wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created (default: 2 minutes)

packageid.description: ID of the metadata package (starts with 033) of which you’re creating a new version
packageid.longDescription: ID of the metadata package (starts with 033) of which you’re creating a new version.

version.description: package version in major.minor format, for example, 3.2
version.longDescription: Package version in major.minor format, for example, 3.2.

managedreleased.longDescription: Creates a managed package version. To create a beta version, don’t include this parameter.

releasenotesurl.longDescription: The release notes URL. This link is displayed in the package installation UI to provide release notes for this package version to subscribers.

postinstallurl.longDescription: The post-install instructions URL. The contents of the post-installation instructions URL are displayed in the UI after installation of the package version.

installationkey.description: installation key for key-protected package (default: null)
installationkey.longDescription: Installation key for creating the key-protected package. The default is null.

wait.description: minutes to wait for the package version to be created (default: 2 minutes)
wait.longDescription: Minutes to wait for the package version to be created. The default is 2 minutes.

force:package1:beta:version:display.description: display details about a first-generation package version

loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetusername.name: targetusername
targetusername.description: username or alias for the target org; overrides default target org

packageversionid.longDescription: ID (starts with 04t) of the metadata package version whose details you want to display.

force:package1:beta:version:list.description: list package versions for the specified first-generation package or for the org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

packageid.longDescription: Metadata package ID (starts with 033) whose package versions you want to list. If not specified, shows all versions for all packages (managed and unmanaged) in the org.

force:package:beta:version:create:list.description:
list package version creation requests

Shows the details of each request to create a package version in the Dev Hub org.

All filter parameters are applied using the AND logical operator (not OR).

To get information about a specific request, run "sfdx force:package:version:create:report" and supply the request ID.

loglevel.name: loglevel
loglevel.description: logging level for this command invocation

targetdevhubusername.name: targetdevhubusername
targetdevhubusername.description: username or alias for the dev hub org; overrides default dev hub org

apiversion.name: apiversion
apiversion.description: override the api version used for api requests made by this command

createdlastdays.name: createdlastdays
createdlastdays.description: created in the last specified number of days (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today)

status.name: status
status.description: filter the list by version creation request status

createdlastdays.description: created in the last specified number of days (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today)
createdlastdays.longDescription: Filters the list based on the specified maximum number of days since the request was created (starting at 00:00:00 of first day to now; 0 for today).

status.description: filter the list by version creation request status
status.longDescription: Filters the list based on the status of version creation requests.

force:package:beta:version:create:report.description:
retrieve details about a package version creation request

Specify the request ID for which you want to view details. If applicable, the command displays errors related to the request.

To show all requests in the org, run "sfdx force:package:version:create:list".
